ASSESSMENTS.title: Learner Self-Reflection 1 – 24354 (v3)
ASSESSMENTS.subtitle: Demonstrate knowledge of health and safety legislation and apply safe working practices in a BCATS environment

questions.text: 1. What legislation covers the safety of people in the workplace?
questions.hint: take the legislation name from the heading/intro. (See p. 9–10)

questions.text: 2. What is the definition of a hazard?
questions.hint: Use the Glossary definition for “Hazard”. (See p. 6)

questions.text: 3. List 2 methods used to identify hazards in the workplace.
questions.hint: Use the “Identifying hazards” section and list two methods mentioned there. (See p. 13–14)

questions.text: 4. Once a hazard has been identified, what are the employer’s responsibilities?
questions.hint: Use the PCBU/employer responsibilities in the Act overview and the hazard management section (controls, information, training, emergency procedures). (See p. 9–11 and p. 13)

questions.text: 5. List 3 health and safety responsibilities of any worker/student.
questions.hint: Use the list under “What it means for you” and choose three responsibilities from that section. (See p. 11)

questions.text: 6. Before you enter a workplace your employer is obliged to provide you with specific safety information. List 4 types of information that would ensure they meet this requirement.
questions.hint: Use the section describing what a PCBU must provide before you enter/work in a workplace. (See p. 10)

questions.text: 7. Where do you get information on the toxicity of the materials that you are working with?
questions.hint: Use the “Chemicals” section and identify where toxicity/hazard information is found for products. (See p. 37 and p. 41)

questions.text:

questions.text: 1. You are required to unload 15 x 40kg bags of cement off the back of a truck. The storage area is 75 metres away across a drive littered with construction waste. Describe the safest and most efficient means to get the cement into the storage area.
questions.hint: Use the “Safe lifting” section and apply it to this situation (route hazards, mechanical aids, team lifting, smaller loads). (See p. 30–31)

questions.text: 2. Describe the correct lifting techniques for a heavy load, such as a bag of cement.
questions.hint: Use the step-by-step lifting technique from the “Safe lifting” section. (See p. 31)

questions.text: 3. Describe the correct technique for carrying a sheet of plywood.
questions.hint: Use the guidance in “Safe lifting” for carrying sheet materials safely. (See p. 30)

questions.text: 4. Identify a risk associated with storing heavy items on shelves.
questions.hint: Use the “Stacking materials” section and identify one risk mentioned for heavy items stored on shelves. (See p. 31)

questions.text: 1. Your first job involves working on a roof. You feel uncomfortable at heights. What should you do?
questions.hint: Use the section about speaking up if you are worried and what to do if work feels unsafe. (See p. 12)

questions.text: 2. What is the recommended angle ratio for a ladder when it is set up?

questions.text: 3. Why are power lines an extreme hazard when you are carrying or using an aluminium ladder?
